page.title: 09HICKSTEAD,JUMPING COURSE
page.content: {THE ALL ENGLAND JUMPING COURSE} The Course is situatated at Hickstead on the west side of the A23 Trunk Road (O.S.268179) Including farmland ,it covers 400 acres .It was opened in 1960 by Mr. Douglas Bunn, who thought of the idea. The Grandstand can hold over 4000 people, and many others can watch from the grounds. 5 people are employed in the office, 8 in the grounds and an extra 40 for Events. This does not include outside catering staff and staff employed by the banks which provide facilities at the site. Horses and riders come from all over the world, the furthest being from New Zealand and Australia. The 3 Stands can hold over 4000 people, one 2000, and the others 1120 and 900 each. There are 3 car parks and when they are full they make use of the fields. Mr. Bunn lives at Hickstead Place.
